positive.review:
Yes, its an over monetised gatcha game, and that mean pay for power. 

BUT, if you are a filthy casual like me, you can get by pretty easy, i enjoy this game because it fits in with my busy schedule, i can get it to farm for me, or do runs and gather while i AFK to look after my real life responsibilities. 

I can also take it on the go too. 

And if you are on Android and do the google rewards stuff (the app that asks if you shopped at certain places, how you paid, and to send them recipts of your shopping trips), you can use the google play dollars you earn to make purchases in game. 

The art styles nice, and at times the story is somewhat interesting. 
And monster design is nice. 

For a Desktop client of a mobile game, its pretty decent, the only issues are, the KB/M controls are kinda rubbish, so a controller is better, and the draw distance for entities is disgustingly short, the pop in of monsters, NPC's, players and gatherables, is like only 5 meters in front of you, no matter the settings. 

Other than that, it makes a fun enough time filler.

Игра увлекает, если вам нравится собирать монстров и стратегически мыслить в боях. Разнообразие существ, которых можно призвать, радует, а графика приятна глазу. Конечно, гринд присутствует, но он вполне терпим.

negative.review: Yes you unlocked a new character, that you can't use until after using another character.  Not going to waste my time and effort on this nonsense.

Long time player here. Had played on Windows. Then when I ditched Windows, I was overjoyed to see this on Steam - thinking that I could play it on Linux. I cannot. I've been playing on Android for months, waiting for this version to not crash after character selection screen. It still crash at time of posting this.

So, I cannot recommend Steam version. It crashes on Linux. If you are on Windows, there is a Windows client on their site.

I had been playing since Evangelion collab. Got all of the characters. Sad to drop the game, but playing on Android just doesn't cut it. Playing on PC is the way to go. A shame it doesn't run on Linux. Crash after character selecting screen.

Not recommended for Steam Deck users. It needs to be synced with PC/Android account in order to play on the Deck. But it is very bugged. Even after syncing with the PC client, it still asks to synced again after restarting automatically. And it repeats like that indefinitely. This is really disappointed, as I'm not comfortable with the PC controls configuration (I wish the camera movement didn't involved holding down on the click to move it), and my phone may not be strong enough to run this.

I personally don't get why it needs to synced to a PC/Android account and not have an account created on the Deck itself.
Yes you unlocked a new character, that you can't use until after using another character.  Not going to waste my time and effort on this nonsense.

gacha game/auto battler. If you're into games that play themselves, like to spin virtual roulette tables, and/or try to make sense of 15 different currencies, this is a game. it's too bad. I'd actually buy this game if it wasn't gacha or an autobattler. the art style is interesting and the monsters look fairly unique.

The game suffers from severe feature bloat, with an overwhelming number of events, items, and collectibles to manage. This is compounded by a lack of essential quality-of-life features, such as an auto-battle mode for TOA Hard. Due to these exhausting and tedious mechanics, I rate it 2/10.

Long time player here. Had played on Windows. Then when I ditched Windows, I was overjoyed to see this on Steam - thinking that I could play it on Linux. I cannot. I've been playing on Android for months, waiting for this version to not crash after character selection screen. It still crash at time of posting this.

So, I cannot recommend Steam version. It crashes on Linux. If you are on Windows, there is a Windows client on their site.

I had been playing since Evangelion collab. Got all of the characters. Sad to drop the game, but playing on Android just doesn't cut it. Playing on PC is the way to go. A shame it doesn't run on Linux. Crash after character selecting screen.
after system update then unable to open
boring.
Not for me.
Can´t login with Steam

I'd actually buy this game if it wasn't gacha or an autobattler. the art style is interesting and the monsters look fairly unique.

The game suffers from severe feature bloat, with an overwhelming number of events, items, and collectibles to manage. This is compounded by a lack of essential quality-of-life features, such as an auto-battle mode for TOA Hard. Due to these exhausting and tedious mechanics, I rate it 2/10.

Long time player here. Had played on Windows. Then when I ditched Windows, I was overjoyed to see this on Steam - thinking that I could play it on Linux. I cannot. I've been playing on Android for months, waiting for this version to not crash after character selection screen. It still crash at time of posting this.

So, I cannot recommend Steam version. It crashes on Linux. If you are on Windows, there is a Windows client on their site.

I had been playing since Evangelion collab. Got all of the characters. Sad to drop the game, but playing on Android just doesn't cut it. Playing on PC is the way to go. A shame it doesn't run on Linux. Crash after character selecting screen.
after system update then unable to open
boring.
Not for me.
Can´t login with Steam

Not recommended for Steam Deck users. It needs to be synced with PC/Android account in order to play on the Deck. But it is very bugged. Even after syncing with the PC client, it still asks to synced again after restarting automatically. And it repeats like that indefinitely. This is really disappointed, as I'm not comfortable with the PC controls configuration (I wish the camera movement didn't involved holding down on the click to move it), and my phone may not be strong enough to run this.

I personally don't get why it needs to synced to a PC/Android account and not have an account created on the Deck itself.
Yes you unlocked a new character, that you can't use until after using another character.  Not going to waste my time and effort on this nonsense.

gacha game/auto battler. If you're into games that play themselves, like to spin virtual roulette tables, and/or try to make sense of 15 different currencies, this is a game. it's too bad.
